questions.question: How do I add audio to a page?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.document.addAudio(blob, attributes)` with audio blob and MediaAttribute object.

questions.question: What parameters does addAudio require?
questions.answer: A Blob object and a MediaAttribute object with mandatory title and optional author properties.

questions.question: How do I get audio as a blob?
questions.answer: Use `fetch(audioUrl).then(r => r.blob())` to convert audio files to blob format.

questions.question: Can I use local audio files?
questions.answer: Yes, use relative paths from add-on root with fetch() to load local audio files.

questions.question: What attributes are required for audio?
questions.answer: Title is mandatory, author is optional in the MediaAttribute object.

questions.question: Can I use remote audio URLs?
questions.answer: Yes, fetch remote audio URLs and convert to blob before adding to document.

questions.question: What audio formats are supported?
questions.answer: Refer to Adobe Express file format requirements page for supported audio formats and size limits.

questions.question: How do I handle audio loading errors?
questions.answer: Use try/catch blocks around fetch() and addAudio() calls to handle loading failures.
